Hello all,

I stumbled on NEAT just a short week ago and have found it very=
 
interesting.  I spent the last few days implementing NEAT in 
PowerBASIC =
and I'm nearly done.  I am doing a rather simple
simulation.

I basically s=
et up a "room" and drop an agent in the middle. 
The 
agent needs to eat=85=
so I place a large circle representing food in
the 
room.  The agent has so=
 many steps to find the food or it 
disappears.   The food is then moved to=
 a new location and the agent 
can try again.  The agent is tested against =
four different food 
locations.  The agent has 8 sensors that allow it to "=
see" in
those 8 
directions.  

Right now with only 50 parents and 10 gener=
ations it is able to find 
all the 4 different food bins after about9 or 10=
 gens...which is 
pretty good.. Especially since I discovered that I have a=
 neuron 
firing issue in my code..

Anyway..I am completely new to NN's...i=
 have no training on them at 
all, although I do know GA's fairly well (I a=
m CEO of bioinformatics 
firm that uses GA's to analyze genetics data).  

=
I have a question I hope you can help with.  the way I setup the 
networks =
allows for recurrent connections to occur.  So suppose you 
have a simple n=
etowrk where input node 1 connects to hidden node 2, 
which connects to hid=
den node 3, which connects to back to node 2.  
How is firing to proceed in=
 such a scenario?  Node 2 can't fire 
until it has all its inputs, yet one =
of its outputs(the one to node 
3) affects what its input will be.  Thanks =
for your help...
          |-------
          v      |
NODE1-->NODE2-->NODE=
3

And what if a node links back to itself?  Then how is the firing 
sequen=
ce to work?  I saw a time delay in teh C code and I am 
guessing this is in=
volved, but I'm not quite sure how...

When I get this working, I would lik=
e to tackle the tic-tac-toe 
problem you guys are working on.

i really app=
reciate all your posts...very enlightening...

Best,
Kevin Cramer
